plan: In the initial rounds, I will test aggressive bidding by slightly exceeding my value to gauge competitors' strategies. If consistently outbid, I'll pivot to conservative bidding, slightly below my value, to minimize losses. I'll also experiment with random high bids to disrupt patterns and gather data on Betty and Charles' responses. Mid-game, I'll analyze bid history to identify trends and adjust accordingly. In later rounds, I'll refine my strategy by balancing risk and reward, aiming to bid close to my value. Throughout, I'll prioritize data collection to optimize long-term profit, adjusting tactics as needed based on observed behaviors.

In the initial rounds, I'll test aggressive bidding by matching or slightly exceeding my value to assess others' bidding tendencies. Mid-game, I'll experiment with underbidding (10-20% below my value) to explore profit margins and detect patterns in opponents' bids. In later rounds, I'll refine my strategy by balancing between aggressive and conservative bids based on observed behaviors, aiming to optimize profit. I'll also occasionally place random bids to gather data on opponents' reactions, especially in tie situations. This dynamic approach will help maximize long-term profit by adapting to opponents' strategies and bid patterns.

In the initial rounds, I'll bid slightly below my value to gather data on Andy's and Betty's strategies. If they consistently bid low, I'll bid aggressively, close to my value, to maximize profit. If they bid high, I'll undercut them slightly to win efficiently. In mid-game, I'll experiment with random aggressive bids to disrupt patterns and test their reactions. Towards the final rounds, I'll refine my strategy based on observed behaviors, potentially using a mix of conservative and aggressive bids to optimize profit while minimizing losses. I'll adapt continuously based on their bidding trends.

Next, I'll test moderate bids near my value, aiming for positive profit. I'll occasionally bid slightly above my value to gather competitor data. Mid-game, I'll analyze trends to adjust strategies. Late-game, I'll balance risk and reward, refining bids based on observed behaviors and maximizing long-term profit.

In the next rounds, I'll bid 5% below my value to test profit margins, occasionally placing random bids to gather data on opponents. I'll adjust based on observed patterns, balancing aggression and conservatism, aiming to optimize profit by adapting to opponents' strategies and bid behaviors.

In rounds 1-5, bid slightly below value to gauge opponents. In rounds 6-10, mix in random aggressive bids to disrupt patterns. In rounds 11-15, adapt with a mix of conservative and aggressive strategies, based on observed trends, to optimize profit while minimizing potential losses.

In round 2, I'll bid slightly above the second-highest bid from previous rounds to maximize profit. I'll also test occasional random high bids to disrupt patterns. Mid-game, I'll analyze trends and adjust strategies, aiming for bids close to my value while maintaining a balance of risk and reward.

In upcoming rounds, I'll bid 5-10% below my value, occasionally testing random bids 20% above or below to gather data on opponents. I'll adapt based on observed patterns, balancing between aggressive and conservative bids to optimize profit, focusing on underbidding when opponents bid high.

In rounds 2-5, bid just below value to gather data. In rounds 6-10, introduce occasional high bids to test thresholds. In rounds 11-15, adapt strategy based on patterns, blending conservative and aggressive bids to maximize profit while minimizing losses. Continuously analyze opponents' behavior for optimal adjustments.

I'll test bids slightly above my value for high-value rounds, aiming to win with profit. For low-value rounds, I'll bid conservatively to minimize losses. Mid-game, I'll analyze competitors' trends, adjusting strategies to balance risk and reward, focusing on maximizing long-term profit through adaptive bidding.

In the next rounds, I'll bid 10% below my value. I'll also experiment with occasional bids 15% above to test opponents' reactions.
